message: Learn some haskell. It will boost your python and general programming skills too.

Over the last two years I've learned Django and everything that goes with it to becoming a decent web developer. I feel like I finally know what I'm talking about and I'm beginning to think of what I should start learning next to compliment Django.

I learned RoR in a hurry and have to say it does have some nice stuff (haml and coffeescript as first class citizens) that blows django away.  But you'll appreciate stuff like the authentication, admin and south which blow RoR away. I think it's worth the time
FYI, HAML and CoffeeScript aren't specific to RoR. RoR does do certain things better, but these are both framework-agnostic.
I didn't like haskells syntax, why should i use it? for performance?
@gtaylor but they work by default rather than having to install something for django
@mcbayrak syntax is actually great when you grok it.
